text.pre: The operation this command will execute

choice.choiceText: creates and configures a new object
adds a child object to the one specified by the -handle param
modified attributes on the given object by the -handle param
deletes the object given by the -handle param

text.pre: The parent handle used for creating this object. Has the form: //vport
A handle returned via a ::<namespace>::dcbxrange_config command. This is used for mode modify
The IxNetwork object typepath that is created after the command is run. Is optional in most cases. Only applies to modes create/add

Represents the chassis identification for the device that transmitted the LLDP frame. The receiving LLDP agent combines the Chassis ID and Port ID to represent the entity connected to the port where the frame was received. Chassis identification for the device that transmitted the LLDP frame.
Highest DCBX protocol version supported by the system.
Enable DCBX TLVs.
Organizationally defined subtype.
The destination MAC address value.
Disabled ranges won't be configured nor validated.
Enable fast initial retransmission.
Multiplier to get actual TTL value used in an LLDPDU.
The total number of interfaces to be created for the range.
Disabled ranges won't be configured nor validated.

When a range of multiple MACs is created with this plugin, this value is the incrementor used to create the addresses in the range. This property is used in conjunction with 'MAC Address' as a base value. Incrementor used when the plugin creates a range of MACs.

When a range of multiple MACs is created with this plugin, this value is the base value used to create the addresses in the range. This property is used in conjunction with 'Increment' as an incrementor. Base value used when the plugin creates a MAC address.

Maximum Transmission Unit. The largest packet that a given network medium can carry. Ethernet, for example, has a fixed MTU of 1500 bytes without and 9500 bytes with Jumbo frame support. ATM has a fixed MTU of 48 bytes and PPP has a negotiated MTU that is usually between 500 and 2000 bytes.
Name of range
Name of range
The vendor identifier value.
Port identification for the device that sent the LLDP frame. Port identification for the device that sent the LLDP frame.
Minimum delay between successive LLDP packets.
This parameter indicates the interval at which LLDP frames are transmitted on behalf of this LLDP agent.
Disabled ranges won't be configured nor validated.
The first ID to be used for the first VLAN tag.
Method used to increment VLAN IDs. May take the following values: 0 (First VLAN first), 1 (Last VLAN first), 2 (All).
Amount of increment per increment step for first VLAN. E.g. increment step = 10 and increment = 2 means increment VLAN ID by 2 for every 10 IPs
Frequency of first VLAN ID increment. E.g., value of 10 means increment VLAN ID once for every 10 IP addresses.
Enable the inner VLAN.
The first ID to be used for the inner VLAN tag.
Amount of increment per increment step for Inner VLAN. E.g. increment step = 10 and increment = 2 means increment VLAN ID by 2 for every 10 IPs
Frequency of inner VLAN ID increment. E.g., value of 10 means increment VLAN ID once for every 10 IP addresses.
The 802.1Q priority to be used for the inner VLAN tag.
The TPID value in the inner VLAN Tag.
Number of unique inner VLAN IDs to use.
Name of range
The 802.1Q priority to be used for the outer VLAN tag.
The TPID value in the outer VLAN Tag.
Number of unique first VLAN IDs to use.
Contains extra VLANs Is a subelement of type: VlanIdInfo

returnValue.value: The returned handle(s) of the config command.

examples.example: See files in the Samples subdirectory

seeAlso.seeAlsoElem: This command applies only to IxNetwork
